trial_identification.studytitle: Can olive leaf extract reduce the risk of metabolic disease?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Can olive leaf extract improve insulin sensitivity in middle aged males? A randomized cross-over trial of olive leaf extract in males aged 35 -55, with a body mass index of 25 - 30.

interventions.interventions: Olive leaf extract (Oleuropein) 66mg (15mL), oral once daily for 12 weeks. Crossed over to placebo with a 6 week washout between interventions. There will be no lead in period.
interventions.comparator: placebo control. The placebo is capsulated safflower oil provided once daily for 12 weeks orally.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Insulin sensitivity. THis will be measured by the Matsuda methodl which is best model compared to the euglycaemic clamp. This involved overnight fasting, with an oral glucose tolerance test. Equipment used will be IV cannulation, and syringes. The Liggins Institute has an in-house assay for insulin level.s
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization)

Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Hand grip strength Measured with a Jamar dynamometer.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Resting Energy Expenditure was determined by indirect calirometry using a TrueOne 2400 Metabolic Measurement system (Parvo Medics Inc., Yorba Sandy, Utah).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Carotid Intima Thickness measurement - measured by ultrasound
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fasting blood sample for lipid profile: LDL, HDL and total cholesterol
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fasting blood sample for liver function tests: AST, ALT, ALP, GGT
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fasting blood sample for Cytokines that influence insulin sensitivity: Interleukin 6 (IL-6), IL-8, tumour necrosis factor alpha, ultrasensitive CRP, Insulin like growth facotr binding protein 1 (IGBBP1), IGFBP2, IGFBP3
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fasting blood sample for Oxidised LDL
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline End of Intervention one (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization) End of intervention two. (placebo or oleuropein depending in randomization

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Any medications BMI outside inclusion range Smokers Diabetes Cardiovascular disease.

trial_design.concealment: Central randomization by computer Blinding by coding, key to code kept by Olive leaf extract supplier (Comvita)

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Comvita New Zealand Ltd 23 Wilson Road South Paengaroa Te Puke Bay of Plenty 3189

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of the study is to formally assess the impact of olive leaf extract on insulin sensitivity. It will be given as a supplement, without altering other aspects of diet or lifestyle.
